name: Ancient Trade Routes
window: At the start of your turn
text: Choose up to 2 other players. You and each of those players gain 2 commodities. During this turn, treat those players as if they were your neighbors.
flavorText: "Stationmaster," Kier said nervously, "these routes have been dead for centuries." Artuno smirked. "See to it that they are reinstated, then. The Memoria will accompany you if necessary."

name: Anomalous Conditions
window: At the start of a round of combat that you are participating in
text: Choose 1 unit type. Units of that type cannot make combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: Unlenn sat on the edge of a knife, his ship groaning against the rift's horizon. His crew clung to their stations, eyes wide, as the enemy's munitions vanished into the void like pebbles dropped into a well.

name: Armament Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, produce up to 2 units that each have a cost of 4 or less in a system that contains 1 of your space docks.
flavorText: "We groveled before the Lazax for liberation," Magmus declared, his voice rising from a gravelly rumble to a roar. "Now we demand it!"

name: Armistice
window: When another player activates a system that contains your units
text: Return that player's command token from that system to their tactic pool and end their turn.
flavorText: The titan stared silently as the other diplomats argued. These small creatures... always squabbling, always grasping for more.

name: Arms Deal
window: Action
text: Choose 1 of your neighbors. That player places 1 cruiser and 1 destroyer from their reinforcements in a system that contains their ships.
flavorText: Ipswitch smirked when the tight-laced broker asked for the ship's documentation. "Probably burned... with the bodies."

name: Artifact Hunters
window: Action
text: Explore 1 planet you control; if the resolved card is a relic fragment, you may spend 4 trade goods to purge that relic fragment and gain 1 relic.
flavorText: "This is..." Dart let out a long whistle. "I can't identify a single part of it. Can you?"

name: Artifact Research
window: When you spend resources to research a technology
text: Discard 1 of your relic fragments to reduce the resources spent by 4 and ignore 1 of that technology's prerequisites.
flavorText: "I don't feel any different," Dart said, his eyes blazing with the fire of a thousand dying worlds. "What do you mean 'oh god your eyes'?"

name: Betrayal
window: At the start of your turn
text: Choose another player. That player cannot play action cards or promissory notes during this turn.
flavorText: Airo Shir Aur interrupted the diplomat with a wave of their hand, "Our dominion knows no border."

name: Black Market Raid
window: Action
text: Spend 3 tokens from your command sheet to gain 1 relic; you may purge any number of your relic fragments to reduce the tokens spent by an equal amount.
flavorText: The black shard dripped with blood—some of it her own. What she had done, she did for the Federation. For all of humankind.

name: Boarding Party
window: After you destroy 1 of your opponent's ships that has a cost of 4 or less
text: Place 1 matching ship from your reinforcements in the active system. [Note: If the unit is a ground force or structure that the other player is treating as a ship, you cannot place that unit.]
flavorText: "Brother," the officer cried, "our ships are breaking up! If we retreat now..." Milor glared at him. "No! Launch the remaining fighters and board the enemy in the lifepods. In Darien's name, we fight to the last!"

name: Bounty
window: After you destroy another player's unit that has a cost of 3 or more
text: Gain 4 trade goods.
flavorText: "Sorry, love, it's just business," Mot said with a hint of regret. S'ula screamed from behind her gag as she watched him reroute the ship toward Arcturus.

name: Breakthrough
window: When or after you research a technology
text: Ready up to 2 of your planets that have a technology specialty.
flavorText: The conference erupted in cheers as Doctor Sucaban announced his findings. Despite the countless sacrifices to reach these results, the wide range of applications made it difficult to feel regret.

name: Brutal Occupation
window: After you gain control of a planet
text: Ready and explore that planet.
flavorText: The harvest of Ordinian was so complete that even the planet's core was depleted. The Nekro left nothing usable. Only its lifeless shell remained.

name: Chain Reaction
window: After you destroy 1 of your opponent's non-fighter ships
text: Produce 1 hit against your opponent's ships. Then, roll 1 die. If the result is 8 or greater, produce 1 additional hit and roll again; this ability cannot produce more than 4 hits.
flavorText: As Jace tore through the enemy line, his ordnance erupted into a symphony of explosions.

name: Classified Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, look at the top 3 cards of the secret objective deck; draw 1 of those cards and shuffle that deck.
flavorText: The din of the council chamber faded as the speaker called for order. Qanoj smiled. A new chapter in his career would begin today.

name: Classified Weapons
window: When 1 of your units make a combat or unit ability roll
text: That unit rolls 2 additional dice.
flavorText: The warnings came too late for the Hylar. When an investigator from the Universities arrived weeks later to survey the carnage, naught was left but smoldering craters. The Gashlai's message was clear.

name: Corporate Lobbying
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player that voted for that outcome gains 2 trade goods.
flavorText: Mot sank into his chair after signing the last of the trade deals. He was gambling with the fate of the galaxy, yet his empire was secure. Many would suffer, but that was a sacrifice he was willing to make.

name: Covert Operation
window: After you move ships into the active system
text: Remove 1 of your ships or ground forces from a system that does not contain 1 of your command tokens and place that unit in the space area of the active system.
flavorText: Sensors erupted in a cacophony of alerts as an entire fleet of unmarked ships emerged from the void, raining destruction upon the unsuspecting convoy.

name: Data Archive
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Exhaust each of your readied planets to explore up to 2 of those planets.
flavorText: Xuange was practically beaming with pleasure, though none would ever know it. Their research had paid off—the vault was exactly where they had expected it to be.

name: Decisive Victory
window: When you win a space combat after the end of its first round
text: Remove your command token from that system.
flavorText: "Now, now, Unlenn," Evelyn smirked as she hailed the Viscount's heavy cruiser. "Looking to bring history to life, are we?" She gave the signal and the Benthic's railguns whirred to life.

name: Defectors
window: After another player produces ships
text: Remove up to 2 of those ships that do not have a capacity value; place matching ships from your reinforcements in any system that contains your ships.
flavorText: Spittle flew forth from The Stillness's crimson maw as a gurgled laugh escaped it. Their minions had done well.

name: Defense Installation
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 planet you control to place 1 PDS from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: Tellurian had heard rumors of their kind roaming to the far corners of the galaxy. However, many such tales had led them to nothing more than decrepit defense systems. Alas, no stone could be left unturned.

name: Defense Installation
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 planet you control to place 1 PDS from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: The native folk had enshrined the ancient structure as if it were a deity. They called it a guardian, as the old texts described it, but they did not understand its true nature.

name: Defense Installation
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 planet you control to place 1 PDS from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: Tellurian raised their arms above their head and emitted a strange noise that the locals presumed to be joyous. In the near distance, one of its kind broke through the earth, shattering the landscape.

name: Defense Installation
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 planet you control to place 1 PDS from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: Tellurian declared that the planet was under the protection of Ul, for the sleepers had awoken and would not rest until peace was assured.

name: Defense Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place up to 2 PDS from your reinforcements on a planet you control.
flavorText: Procyon's cold silence enraged Sakora. "We are the watchers on the walls, not you. We are the shield that guards all realms!"

name: Deflection
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: Choose 1 strategy card. During this strategy phase, other players must spend 1 token from their strategy pool to choose that strategy card, if able.
flavorText: "It was their idea," Zo Cou shrugged. "Or so they believe. Their mistake was a poison I fed them. Now they choke on it."

name: Derelict Station
window: After your ships move out of, into, or through a system that does not contain planets
text: Explore a frontier token that is in that system or gain 2 trade goods.
flavorText: The inhabitants of this forlorn place had long forgotten civilization. Their caches, however, bespoke what they once were.

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: A spontaneous cheer erupted from the command staff as the Letnev dreadnought broke apart. Neekuaq was filled with pride.

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: Neekuaq allowed the crew a moment to celebrate the fortunate shot before reining them in.

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: As the crew calmed, Neekuaq shouted, "Excellent, but enough celebration! Turn our batteries on the escorts before they flee."

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: The Loncara Ssodu's secondary batteries made quick work of the escorts as the dreadnought's crew abandoned ship.

name: Efficiency Initiative
window: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
text: Reduce the total PRODUCTION value of those units by up to 3 to gain an equal number of commodities and trade goods. [Note: These trade goods are available to be spent during this PRODUCTION.]
flavorText: I48S surveyed the new installation, noting several blocking routines. The new processes increased output by nearly 11%—and with a little work, he was sure the enhancers could achieve another 4%.

name: Espionage
window: Action
text: Choose another player. That player shows you their action cards or 1 random secret objective from their hand. [Note: Their choice. If they have no secrets, they must show you their action cards.]
flavorText: Z'eu closed her eyes and listened for a moment as her guests gasped for air, collapsing one by one as the poison took them. Such is the beauty of the Naalu, she thought.

name: Exploration Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, explore up to 3 different non-cultural planets you control.
flavorText: Harrugh gripped the straps of his pack tightly. Even in the blazing sun, he felt a chill run down his spine. Spirits roamed here. Why must the council disturb them?

name: Field Test
window: At the start of your turn
text: Choose 1 technology in your technology deck. Treat that technology as if you own it until the end of your turn.
flavorText: Another jolt from the machine surged through Rin's limbs. It no longer bothered her. She was changing. Not just mentally, but physically as well.

name: Final Mission
window: After 1 of your units is destroyed during combat, if you are the attacker
text: Choose and destroy 1 of your opponent's participating units that has a cost equal to or lower than than your destroyed unit's cost.
flavorText: In these white-hot flames, the Gashlai knew only ecstasy.

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: "Oy, Captain, best ye lock in," the wily pilot chuckled. "I learned this little maneuver in me scavenging days." Before Mendosa could protest, the ship began to groan under the strain.

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: Alerts flashed as they screamed ahead. "Wait for the computer to chart, Douglas!" Mendosa barked. The pilot laughed and pointed to his head. "Oy, they call me Doug, sir—Deft Doug if ye like. I've got a keen eye for charting, and a good nose too." Then, it was dark.

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: The ship's power flickered off, but the strain remained. The pilot had flung them into the void, trusting his intuition, and Mendosa was not eager to discover what awaited them on the other end.

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: Somehow they were alive and ahead of schedule. Deft Doug's hoots turned to yowls as Mendosa rapped him on the head. "Better to call ye Deaf Doug. Ye won't be 'eyeballing' our routes ever again!"

name: Flawless Strategy
window: After you exhaust your strategy card
text: Resolve the secondary ability of that strategy card; do not spend or place a command token to resolve that ability.
flavorText: PROTOCOL SUCCESSFUL<< [ID:NULL] DEFEAT INEVITABLE<< PEERLESS MANY<< INFINITE ONE<< [ID:NIITAKA]<< QUEUED1<< QUEUED2<< QUEUED3...

name: Foreign Aid
window: When you perform a strategic action
text: Choose up to 2 other players. During this strategic action, those players may spend command tokens from their reinforcements instead of their strategy pool.
flavorText: As he projected scenes of their reconstruction efforts, Odlynn was interrupted by the council's rapturous applause.

name: Freedom Fighters
window: After you commit units to land on a planet you do not control in the active system
text: Place up to 1 infantry from your reinforcements on each planet in that system.[Note: These infantry cannot be targeted by PDS.]
flavorText: Harrugh had brought them supplies and hope. On the promised day, they would repay him with their determination for liberation.

name: Frontier Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, replenish your commodities and explore a frontier token on the game board.
flavorText: Acamar held up the partial transcription of a legendary Lazax war treatise. With the return of their ancient enemy, finding the full document was imperative.

name: Graviton Negators
window: At the start of a ground combat
text: Choose 1 of your non-fighter ships in the active system. That ship participates in the "Roll Dice" step of this combat as if it were a ground force on the planet.
flavorText: The battle seemed to freeze as the J.N.S. Hylarim entered low orbit, its shadow eclipsing the conflict—and the hopes of its enemies.

name: Heist
window: After you gain control of a planet that was controlled by another player
text: Take or discard up to 2 of that player's relic fragments. For each relic fragment discarded, gain 2 trade goods.
flavorText: Mot awoke in a pool of his own blood. S'ula had the courtesy to let him live—just barely—but he was too weak to stand. So, he lay in front of the empty vault and wept.

name: Hidden Initiatives
window: Action
text: Look at the top 2 cards of the secret objective deck; you may replace 1 of your unscored secret objectives with 1 of those cards. Then, shuffle the secret objective deck.
flavorText: M'aban sighed at the man's pleas. The lengthy hunt for this spy had filled her with exhilaration, but seeing him now, bathed in the stench of fear and utterly devoid of composure, disgusted her.

name: Hijacked Signal
window: After another player moves ships into a system that contains your units
text: Place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system.
flavorText: The Hacan paid heavily to contain the breach. 2RAM identified the culprit as Acidos and warned them that the worst was yet to come.

name: Hostile World
window: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control
text: Roll 3 dice. For each result of 6 or greater, produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of those units.
flavorText: The old soldier interrupted the discussion of N'orr ground tactics with a snort. "It's not the enemy you need to be worried about, lads. It's the godforsaken planet."

name: Intrigue
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Look at the top 2 and bottom 2 cards of the agenda deck. Place each card on the top or bottom of the deck in any order.
flavorText: After years of honing the stillness of his mind, Ronald's schemes were finally paying off. Jord had paid him well to infiltrate M'aban's inner circle, but they would only ever receive a pittance of the benefits. He served only the Cabal.

name: Ixthian Gift
window: At the end of a turn during which you resolved a transaction with a player
text: Commit 1 infantry from your reinforcements to a non-home planet that player controls. If that planet contains their ground forces, resolve a ground combat. [Note: This does not trigger PDS.]
flavorText: Unlenn had rarely felt so smug after extorting his enemy. However, as he turned to the Mahact emissary, he grew cold—she was smiling.

name: Joint Research
window: After you gain a non-faction technology
text: Choose another player. That player gains that technology.
flavorText: Rin had received multiple warnings to avoid working with the Vuil'Raith. However, existential threats to the galaxy had never been enough to stifle her curiosity.

name: Lazax Cache
window: At the end of your turn
text: Exhaust 1 non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex. Then, gain trade goods equal to that planet's combined resource and influence values.
flavorText: The hoard of Lazax artifacts dated back to the dawn of the empire. The thought of selling these prized possessions cut him deeply, but Berekar knew they were the coin required to reclaim their home.

name: Lost Treatise
window: At the start of your turn
text: Either redistribute your command tokens or place 1 command token from your reinforcements in your fleet pool.
flavorText: Unlenn massaged his brow and shut off his holoscreen. The magnum opus on Lazax war theory at his fingertips, and yet... it was the most boring piece of literature he'd ever had the displeasure to read.

name: Malfunction
window: After you activate a system
text: Choose 1 unit in that system. That unit loses its printed abilities during this tactical action.
flavorText: Ba'al watched as, one by one, each of the settlements went offline. He was not some fool to be laughed at. Who was laughing now?

name: Mercenary Contract
window: After a player activates a system that contains your units
text: Produce up to 2 ships in that system that have a combined cost of 4 or less.
flavorText: There is an old adage present in nearly every galactic civilization that money cannot buy true happiness, but money could, in fact, buy a new ship. And that made Tai very, very happy indeed.

name: Micrometeoroid Storm
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that contains another player's fighters. Roll 1 die for each fighter in that system. For each result of 6 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.
flavorText: The disaster investigation unit could not determine whether it was an act of providence or the beginning stages of an incursion.

name: Miraculous Escape
window: When 1 of your non-fighter ships would be destroyed
text: That ship is not destroyed. [Note: Combat hits are assigned simultaneously, and thus excess hits will not destroy this ship.]
flavorText: The Memoria was known for miraculously surviving perilous situations, but Omar could not believe that it had managed to escape the Van Hauge. He was certain now - this 'Nomad' was not playing by the rules.

name: Mysterious Brokers
window: After you pass
text: You may purge 1 of your relics to gain 1 relic. If you do not, gain trade goods equal to the number of players that have not passed.
flavorText: The broker sat unmoving. Its body, nearly stone, lent it to such an activity. However, this being was worth its weight in credits, for its memories stretched to the dawn of wonders, and its stories flowed to those who would fulfill its needs.

name: Opportunists
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that contains another player's ships and no planets. Place 1 cruiser and 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in that system and resolve a space combat.
flavorText: The sensors of the lead ship exploded with an array of alarms and damage alerts as a fleet of unmarked ships poured forth from the wormhole. Reports be damned, these were no mere pirates.

name: Overtime
window: At the end of your turn
text: Spend up to 2 trade goods to ready an equal number of non-home planets you control.
flavorText: Captain Agerro sighed. The work was not what he had expected, not what he had wanted, but it had to be done. Fighting would come later.

name: Outgun
window: When you produce 1 or more hits
text: Produce 1 additional hit.
flavorText: The planet's defense system was formidable, far exceeding their expectations. Sek'kus wondered how many of her warriors would perish during the descent.

name: Outgun
window: When you produce 1 or more hits
text: Produce 1 additional hit.
flavorText: C-beams glittered in the dark as the N'orr vanguard descended upon their enemies like rain, their exoskeletons reflecting death.

name: Outgun
window: When you produce 1 or more hits
text: Produce 1 additional hit.
flavorText: The sight of Sek'kus on her untouchable rampage filled the others with passion. The explosions that illuminated her were a crescendo to the madness.

name: Outgun
window: When you produce 1 or more hits
text: Produce 1 additional hit.
flavorText: The fury and majesty of G'hom Sek'kus and her Valkyrie broke the enemy. It was clear they were no match for such reckless hate.

name: Outmaneuver
window: When 1 or more hits are produced against your units
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: T'esla reflexively flinched away from the danger she sensed. "All ships commence evasive maneuvers. Zere's flak comin'."

name: Outmaneuver
window: When 1 or more hits are produced against your units
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: Fortunately, T'esla's warning gave the cruiser's helmsman just enough time to roll the ship to port. "Zat would've cut us in half," he muttered.

name: Outmaneuver
window: When 1 or more hits are produced against your units
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: T'esla checked her wingman, relieved to see that he had managed to dodge the flak as well. "Close in and open fire!"

name: Outmaneuver
window: When 1 or more hits are produced against your units
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: The capital ship's massive cannons were unable to track the brigades of fighters swarming it like insects.

name: Patronage
window: When a public objective is revealed
text: Look at the top 2 cards of the deck that matches that objective; you may replace that objective with 1 of those cards. Then, shuffle that deck.
flavorText: The Custodians' proclamation mired Elder Qanoj in anxiety. More support for his enemies, thinly veiled under the guise of tradition.

name: Pivot
window: Action
text: Discard between 1 and 3 action cards from your hand to draw an equal number of action cards.
flavorText: "We must not become stagnant. Stagnation is what broke this galaxy," I48S said, barely hesitating at his patient's screams. "Pain? Let's remove that."

name: Project Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda and choose up to 2 action cards in the discard pile. If your prediction is correct, take those cards.
flavorText: Gil's career at the Civita Planetar was prolific, with friends in hundreds of governments and favors owed in many more.

name: Propaganda
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Exhaust up to 2 of your non-home planets other than Mecatol Rex to place a number of infantry from your reinforcements on each of those planets equal to that planet's influence value.
flavorText: The Federation anthem blared from the holoscreen as troops paraded across it. "They're doing their part. Are you? Join the Mobile Legion and save the galaxy!"

name: Prophecy
window: When you would roll a die
text: Choose the result of that die roll instead.
flavorText: Ahk-Syl Siven flared, bright red briefly overtaking blue. "Would I lie to you?" The flame pulsed, suspended in the air before him. Was it real? Or just an illusion?

name: Public Outrage
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each other player that voted for that outcome reveals 1 random action card from their hand; take 1 of those cards and discard the rest.
flavorText: As they placed the noose around her neck, Menda wailed. Suffi, who was next in line, gave her a confident smile. "First time?"

name: Public Support
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Choose 1 outcome of this agenda. Each player that casts votes for that outcome casts 3 additional votes and draws 1 action card.
flavorText: Elder Junn had seen many ruling parties come and go during his long years. This one would support his policies, or it would be gone in the blink of an eye. He'd make sure of it.

name: Reconstruction
window: Action
text: Ready 1 of your planets that has a trait. Then, reveal the top 3 cards of an exploration deck that matches that planet; attach each attachment that you reveal to that planet and discard the rest.
flavorText: Tungstantus collapsed mid-step as their energy depleted. The world was far from its former glory, and they would not rest until it was a paradise once more.

name: Reengineer
window: After you discard an action card
text: Either take that card from the discard pile or draw 2 action cards. Then, discard 1 action card.
flavorText: The artifact seemed to purr as Perdin laid his hand on it. A fount of ancient knowledge, forgotten even by the Mahact, it was now his people's precious key to prosperity.

name: Refabrication
window: After 1 of your non-fighter ships is destroyed
text: Produce 1 ship of that type in a different system that contains 1 of your units with PRODUCTION; reduce the cost of the produced ship by up to 4.
flavorText: The production of the Van Hauge VI was completed in record time. As it left the docking bay, Dannel smiled—a rare occurrence these days. "Glory to the Yin, my brothers. You have done us all proud."

name: Rehashed Debates
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Discard this agenda. Then, choose any other agenda from the discard pile or in play. Players vote on that agenda instead.
flavorText: Perdin was surrounded by a crowd of doomsayers, incensed by his agreements regarding the Ixthian artifact. "Fools," he sighed, "you will soon understand the providence of Winnaran wisdom."

name: Reinforcements
window: After 1 of your non-fighter ships is destroyed during a space combat
text: Place 2 fighters from your reinforcements in the active system.
flavorText: "We're too late!" the rookie pilot cried as a war sun tore through their fleets. "No, sonny, this fight has just begun," Jace bellowed. "4th Legion, with me! We're sending that hunk of scrap back to the void."

name: Relay Connection
window: After you produce a ship in a system
text: Produce 1 ship of that type in any number of other systems that contain 1 of your units with PRODUCTION; reduce the combined cost of the produced ships by 2.
flavorText: His engineers broke into celebration as Umbat called out in praise, "The forge burns my soul alight! This is our freedom!"

name: Relic Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 relic.
flavorText: Qanoj watched the light reflect off of the shard and dance about his chambers. Such a pretty thing. And yet, so many had died for it.

name: Rendezvous
window: After the "Movement" step of your tactical action in a system that does not contain other players' units
text: Remove your command token from that system and end your turn.
flavorText: "Frankly, sir, this operation is..." The Admiral trailed off. Alastair leaned back in his chair and finished her sentence, "A logistical nightmare? I recommend you get to it then."

name: Retrofit
window: After a player activates a system
text: Choose 1 of your non-fighter ships. That unit gains SPACE CANNON 6, BOMBARDMENT 5, or SUSTAIN DAMAGE during this tactical action.
flavorText: The massive cannon platform floated between two ships, held in place by tractor beams. Mendosa admired the engineering—right up until it fired and hurled itself into deep space.

name: Revolution
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: During this strategy phase, strategy card choices start with the speaker and proceed counterclockwise.
flavorText: In the distance, a huge explosion illuminated the sky. Brother Milor gripped the rails of his balcony as he watched the chaos unfolding in the streets below. The people demanded a revolution, and he would deliver one.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: Kyver waited patiently, cloaked outside the space station in transparasteel plating. They loathed eliminating children, but the prophecy of this messiah would have to be silenced.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: Dirzuga Ohao stood next to the leader of the revolutionaries, his pale eyes full of accusation. "Not every secret is lost in death, Brother Milor," they said in unison.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: The past flooded Ahk-Syl Siven's thoughts upon seeing the Mahact, and the memory of his essence being rewritten on a subatomic level surged involuntarily to the forefront of his consciousness.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: The growing creature spasmed in the genetic spinner's tank as Ssruu slowly emptied poison into its feeding pouch.

name: Schematics Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda and choose 1 non-faction technology owned by another player. If your prediction is correct, gain that technology.
flavorText: R7-82's optic servo motors malfunctioned momentarily as the council discussed 'feeding' the Virus to satiate its hunger.

name: Sensor Jam
window: After a player moves ships into the active system
text: Your cruisers and destroyers in the active system gain SUSTAIN DAMAGE during this tactical action.
flavorText: "What's wrong with these blasted sensors?" The Count slapped his data console, and with that, it displayed the enemy's signature in a thirteenth different location.

name: Shock Troops
window: At the start of a combat
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat.
flavorText: "Our training has borne the finest warriors in the galaxy," Jace promised. "We are the rising of a new dawn. A day of death and reckoning. Now for wrath, now for ruin, and a red nightfall!"

name: Short-lived Clone
window: At the start of your turn
text: Choose 1 agent. Ready or exhaust that agent.
flavorText: "Damn thing tried to kill me," Suffi grunted as she heaved the corpse onto the floor. "Best we destroy that spinner after all. This galaxy can barely handle one of me."

name: Shrapnel Turrets
window: At the start of a space combat
text: Choose any number of your ships in the active system that have a capacity value. Each of those ships gain ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE 8(x2) during this combat.
flavorText: Mendosa grinned widely as he eyed the cargo. "Ye say we're out of munitions, yet look at all this junk lyin' around. It'll shred 'em fine!"

name: Side Project
window: Action
text: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to research a technology that has no prerequisites.
flavorText: As the council meeting drew to a close, Suffi stood up. "Before we adjourn, I'd like to announce that our neural enhancement project has entered the final phase of clinical trials."

name: Side Project
window: Action
text: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to research a technology that has no prerequisites.
flavorText: A projection showed four individuals competing in a task, with one participant fiercely outpacing the others as he interfaced with the device through thought alone. The council murmured approvingly.

name: Side Project
window: Action
text: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to research a technology that has no prerequisites.
flavorText: After the meeting, Xander wore a look of endearment. "I swear, Suffi, where did you even find the time to organize this project?"

name: Side Project
window: Action
text: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to research a technology that has no prerequisites.
flavorText: Suffi parted her hair, revealing a small metal plate indicative of a neural implant. Xander gasped, realizing she must have had the surgery long ago. "You did this before the trials were completed?" Suffi shrugged. "Before the trials even began."

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: The armada followed the Hil Colish into the fading wormhole.

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: The Cabal Taskmaster bellowed, "They are too practiced at fleeing!"

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: Sai's fleet had escaped with ease, but for how long?

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: The Cabal left a parting message: "Run, but you cannot hide."

name: Smuggler Routes
window: Action
text: Move 1 of your ships to an adjacent system that does not contain other players' units; ignore the effects of anomalies during this action. [Note: You can transport units during this movement.]
flavorText: Greg closed his book, a tale of the Passage of Tears, with a sigh. As he looked to the sky and imagined the space beyond—a place he had never been—he quietly sang in tune with the Symphony, "I wanna be where the Mentak are. I wanna see—wanna see 'em raidin'."

name: Special Considerations
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Ready up to 3 planets you control. Game effects cannot prevent you from playing this card or voting on this agenda.
flavorText: "It is our right to determine the future of this artifact," Mathis said calmly, flashing his imperial seal in a practiced motion. "Are we not owed such respect?"

name: Stasis Haul
window: After you activate a system
text: During this tactical action, apply +2 to the capacity value of 1 of your ships and gain 1 commodity for each different system it moves into or through.
flavorText: The cargo ships blasted out of the planet's gravity field. Vast space and time lay before them. For all, it meant the promise of new life; for some, it would mean death.

name: Stolen Prototype
window: After you destroy 1 of another player's units
text: Research a unit upgrade technology of that unit's type; ignore 1 of that technology's prerequisites.
flavorText: Ssruu looked back from the pod as the infiltration team escaped the fiery inferno. Only after they cleared the blast radius did he loosen his grip on the stolen schematics.

name: Stranded Ship
window: Action
text: Place 1 cruiser from your reinforcements in a system that does not contain planets or other players' units.
flavorText: "To be clear," Tai said flatly, "you knew this ship had no weapons, no fuel, and a faulty navigation when you purchased it. And yet,"—he gestured—"here we are."

name: Strategic Focus
window: After you pass
text: Resolve the secondary ability of 1 readied or unchosen strategy card; do not spend or place a command token to resolve that ability.
flavorText: "With every imaginable incarnation of death at our doorsteps, they still reach for more," Rinn sighed. "We must remain focused. Steady."

name: Syndicate
window: Action
text: Reveal a number of cards from the top of the action card deck equal to the number of players. Each player takes 1 of those cards of your choice.
flavorText: "What if I'm not ready?" the operative asked, looking away. Harka squeezed her hand. "Believe in me, who believes in you."

name: Tomb Raiders
window: Action
text: Gain 2 commodities. Then, reveal the top card of each exploration deck; gain any relic fragments that you reveal and discard the rest.
flavorText: As her hostages hurled insults, S'ula began to laugh. "This artifact was the property of countless civilizations. You thought its journey would end with yours?"

name: Unexpected Strategy
window: When you would place a token from your strategy pool or reinforcements on the game board
text: Gain 1 command token instead.
flavorText: Jace was perplexed by Ahk-Syl Siven's decision to retreat deeper into Federation territory—until the once-routed fleet rallied into a devastating assault.

name: Unstable Gate
window: After a player activates a system that contains your units
text: Choose 1 other system. That system is adjacent to the active system during this tactical action.
flavorText: The conduit was tearing itself apart as the space within it melted away to reveal the location of the beacon. Their panic quickly culled their jubilation.

name: Virulent Payload
window: After you produce a hit against units on a planet
text: Produce 1 additional hit. Then, roll 1 die; on a result of 6 or greater, resolve this ability again.
flavorText: As they cut through the ancient structure's wall, Dart's laser-cutter illuminated a canister close to the beam. Tai squealed, "E-e-exterrix gas!"—as Dart ran.

name: Void Path
window: At the start of your turn
text: Choose 1 system that does not contain planets. During this turn, you treat that system as if it contains each non-delta wormhole.
flavorText: "As we lack the form of your world, you will lack that of ours," Taivra said without tone. "Let us hope you are better prepared for your first pilgrimage than we for ours."

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
text: Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: The prisoners trudged into the factory like a silent gray mass. For a moment, the gate seemed like a dark maw swallowing them whole.

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
text: Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: Warden Gim shuddered as one of the prisoners fell from exhaustion and was trampled by the others. The munitions were crucial to his alliance, but the price weighed heavily on his soul.

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
text: Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: Like clockwork, transport ships landed every cycle with new workers, freshly captured on the frontlines. The same ships departed with munitions in place of flesh.

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
text: Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: Gim wondered which would give out first: the mines, the machines, the men, or his own fragile mind.
